catalog_info.title: Evolution and Religion
catalog_info.description: A seminar focusing on the relationship between Darwinian evolution and religion. This relationship has contributed in major ways to the social response to evolutionary biology from the 19th century to the present. We will consider this relationship from a number of perspectives, relying on the reading of primary texts from Paley to Dennett. We will consider both religious critiques of evolutionary theory and evolutionary approaches to understanding religion.
